page.title: 10BELLRINGING IN GOOSTREY
page.content: {BELLS & BELLRINGING There are six bells in St Luke's Church, Goostrey, three being the original ones. The earliest is inscribed "Jesus be our speed 1616". The second has the insciption "God Save His Church 1705. G.G.Peter Kinsey John Lowe Church-wardens". The third has no inscription but bears a lion passant and a fleur-de-lys. The fourth and fifth bells date from 1869 and the sixth from 1912. Goostrey has an enthusiastic group of about 16 bellringers,ranging in age from 9 to 73. The young beginners ring rounds & call changes before Sunday services. The more experienced ringers have a wider repertoire including "Grandsire Doubles", "Plain Bob Minor" and "Plain Bob Doubles". The bell ringers also ring at Easter, Christmas and for weddings.
